title: executation masks
body:
## Checklist

- [x ] Read CONTRIBUTING.md, and accept the CLA by including the provided snippet. We will not accept PR without this.
- [ x] Run pre-commit hook.
- [x ] If you changed Rust code, run `cargo check`, `cargo clippy`, `cargo test`.

## PR Description

Add execution masks + some refactoring allowing for Convs to be CUDA Graphed.
What we are losing is the ability to pass in arbitrary amount of audio, now the end user is responsible for buffering. When running on CUDA, with CUDAGraph activated ( the default), one should also always pass the same amount of audio.

title: Fix a potential issue in mlx import when importing pytorch safetensor model
body:
## Checklist

- [x] Read CONTRIBUTING.md, and accept the CLA by including the provided snippet. We will not accept PR without this.
- [x] Run pre-commit hook.
- [x] If you changed Rust code, run `cargo check`, `cargo clippy`, `cargo test`.

## PR Description

<!-- Description for the PR -->

When converting the recently released Japanese version of Moshi at https://huggingface.co/nu-dialogue/j-moshi-ext to MLX, there was a tensor size mismatch error due to the converted model now using `n_q_main` for Depth transformer.

You can try out the MLX converted model with using this script by running `python -m moshi_mlx.local --hf-repo akkikiki/j-moshi-ext-mlx`.

title: Fix two small issues with seanet layers in streaming mode.

## Checklist

- [x] Read CONTRIBUTING.md, and accept the CLA by including the provided snippet. We will not accept PR without this.

<!-- Description for the PR -->

title: Fix streaming propagate + fixing bug in KV Cache
body:
## Checklist

- [x] Read CONTRIBUTING.md, and accept the CLA by including the provided snippet. We will not accept PR without this.
- [x] Run pre-commit hook.
- [ ] If you changed Rust code, run `cargo check`, `cargo clippy`, `cargo test`.

## PR Description

Depformer was never set in streaming mode which explain deterioration in quality in the CUDA demo (weights from first cb used all the way + no kv cache on previous cb...). Sorry about that, I'm quite surprised how it still somehow worked not so bad despite that pretty massive change.
Also fixing a bug in the KVCache, not as bad, would only have impact when wrapping around based on unit tests I ran on the internal codebase.

Update: after further review, the bug had no impact except if sin embeddings were to be used in the depformer which is not the case. This is because the original function was a mess and still properly put any children of Depformer in streaming mode even if Depformer itself was not streaming

title: Add unit tests to ensure submodules are causal and streamable
body:
## Checklist

- [ X ] Read CONTRIBUTING.md, and accept the CLA by including the provided snippet. We will not accept PR without this.
- [ X ] Run pre-commit hook.
- [ X ] If you changed Rust code, run `cargo check`, `cargo clippy`, `cargo test`.

## PR Description

Add unit tests to check that the following submodules are causal and streamable:
* StreamingConv1d
* StreamingConvTranspose1d
* SEANetResnetBlock
* SEANetDecoder

Please see [the related issue](https://github.com/kyutai-labs/moshi/issues/134) for more context.

## CLA Snippet:

title: Tweak the CI for libpython.
body: Install the python dev package for the rust CI.

title: Upgrade candle to 0.7.1.
body:
## PR Description

Upgrade candle to 0.7.1 so as to support cuda 12.6 and the new rotating kv cache.

title: Add the ssl flag to the pytorch server too.
body:
## PR Description

Add the `-ssl` flag to the pytorch server too so that https can be used rather than http.

title: Add an optional flag to use https on macos.
body:
## PR Description

This makes it easier to run on remote boxes, e.g. for #106

title: Allow longer conversations with mlx.
body:
## PR Description

Allow for longer sessions in moshi-mlx:
- Switch to rustymimi 0.2.2 where the max-seq-len is 8192 rather than 4096 allowing for 5min40s of conversations (as the mimi transformer runs at 25Hz).
- Set the default seq len to 4000 for the main generation routine.

title: Increase max_seq_len for mimi-pyo3 and make it configurable.
body:
## PR Description

Currently the max-seq-len for the mimi transformer in mimi-pyo3 was set to 4096 resulting in only ~2min30s of conversation. Bump this to a default of 8192 to reach 5 mins and make it configurable just in case.

title: Dockerized

## PR Description

Added Dockerfiles and docker compose to run the service on a Linux with the NVIDIA Container Toolkit

### Docker Server setup

#### Install the NVIDIA Container Toolkit

https://docs.nvidia.com/datacenter/cloud-native/container-toolkit/latest/install-guide.html

#### Start the docker container
```docker compose up```

title: Update candle.

## PR Description

Update the candle dependency to incorporate this PR https://github.com/huggingface/candle/pull/2490 (which applies to mimi running on metal).

title: Avoid running the rustymimi CI on each commit.
body:
## PR Description

The rustymimi bits of the CI are only useful when making a release of rustymimi so constrain the form of the tag required to run this.

- [x] Run pre-commit hook.
- [x] If you changed Rust code, run `cargo check`, `cargo clippy`, `cargo test`.

## PR Description

just trying on windows, but notice your `profile` config is not working because they are not in workspace root for rust, and so release version wouldn't include symbol and bad for debugging, hence a quick fix

title: CI for publishing rustymimi.
body: Add some CI for publishing the rustymimi pypi package automatically and for all platforms.

title: added `moshi-*` scripts/entrypoints to pyproject.toml
body:
## Checklist

- [x] Read CONTRIBUTING.md, and accept the CLA by including the provided snippet. We will not accept PR without this.
- [x] Run pre-commit hook.
- [x] If you changed Rust code, run `cargo check`, `cargo clippy`, `cargo test`.

## CLA

I, Erik Bjäreholt (@ErikBjare), confirm that I have read and understood the terms of the CLA of Kyutai-labs, as outlined in the repository's CONTRIBUTING.md, and I agree to be bound by these terms.

## PR Description

With this change you can now install moshi with:
 - `pipx install moshi` (once it's on PyPI)
 - `pipx install -e ./moshi/moshi` (which I tested)

This wasn't possible before since pipx requires a valid entrypoint to allow installation.

title: Adding Cla

title: Typos
body:
Some minor typos in the text. 

There are also two potential typos I wasn't sure how to fix. Both are in moshi/README.md:

  * In ``Requirements``: *You will need at least Python 3.10. We kept a minimal set of dependencies for the current project.
It was tested with PyTorch 2.2 or 2.4. *  -> I assume the 2.2 and 2.4 are a typo ?

 * In ``Development``: `mimi_test.py` does not exist in test but I am not sure if it should be replaced by `test_mimi.py` or `mimi_streaming_test.py`

title: Per repo loading + final cosmetic and doc changes
body:
- changing flags so that they are consistent in all commands (except Rust I didn't change)
- adding list of models
- adding API example for moshi pytorch
- adding loading from separate repo

title: chore: favicon
chore: autoopen browser
body: Grug may include the `s` and become confused, remove that possibility :) (particularly because the rust version is `https`)

title: Readme [5/N]
body:
update the readme.

You can have a look from https://github.com/kyutai-labs/moshi/tree/readme

I explicitly repeat some of the information for PyPI.

title: chore: update config
body: `hf-hub` does not support redirects for large files: https://github.com/huggingface/hf-hub/issues/33

title: Client update to connect directly [4/N]
body: avoid having to click twice on connect

title: Improving small things [3/N]
body:
various small improvements:
- including license in each package, as this how it will be shipped on PyPI
- using automatic discovery of packages in pyproject.toml
- adding -q shortcut
- using import in the form `from moshi_mlx import model, utils` to prevent shadowing by `moshi_mlx` when exeucting from the root of the repo.

title: refacto [1/N]
body:
- having a method to resolve checkpoints, this allows end user to easily override with a local file.
- changing visibility of configs (I don't want people to assume it will stay there if we start having more models, and we no longer keep all in one file).
- trying to make pyright happy
- avoid using global variables in server.py
- adding gradio support

A lot is still untested.

body: This will break but done separately so that you can see the diff better in the next PR.
